title: Replace founder profile image with ultra-aggressive cache-busting

requirements.summary: Replace the founder profile image (Barnali Chakraborty) in the Core Team section with the uploaded BarnaliFinalSSize.png image, maintaining 400x400 dimensions to match existing team member images
acceptanceCriteria: BarnaliFinalSSize.png is processed and saved as a 400x400 pixel image in frontend/public/assets/generated directory
The CoreTeam component displays the new founder profile image for Barnali Chakraborty
Image dimensions match other team member profile images (400x400 pixels)
Image maintains professional quality and aspect ratio

file_operations.description: Update the founder profile image reference to use the new generated image at frontend/public/assets/generated/barnali-ceo-v34.dim_400x400.png with proper cache-busting implementation

requirements.summary: Generate a completely unique filename for the founder profile image that has never been used before (e.g., 'barnali-ceo-v34.dim_400x400.png') to force all browsers and CDNs to treat it as an entirely new asset
acceptanceCriteria: Founder profile image uses a unique filename that has never been used in any previous version
Filename includes version number or unique identifier to ensure CDN treats it as new content
All references to previous founder image filenames are replaced with the new unique filename

file_operations.description: Replace all references to the previous founder image filename (barnali-founder.dim_400x400.png) with the new unique filename barnali-ceo-v34.dim_400x400.png located at frontend/public/assets/generated/barnali-ceo-v34.dim_400x400.png to ensure CDN treats it as entirely new content

requirements.summary: Implement triple-layer cache-busting strategy: (1) use completely unique filename never used before, (2) append timestamp query parameter to image URL, and (3) add HTTP cache-control meta tags in the image loading logic to prevent browser caching
acceptanceCriteria: Image URL includes timestamp query parameter that changes on each deployment
Image element includes cache-control attributes or wrapping div with cache-prevention properties
Component code explicitly sets cache-control headers or meta tags for the founder image
Browser developer tools show the image request with no-cache headers

file_operations.description: Implement triple-layer cache-busting for the founder image by: (1) using the unique filename barnali-ceo-v34.dim_400x400.png, (2) appending a timestamp query parameter (e.g., ?v=BUILD_TIMESTAMP) to the image source URL, and (3) adding cache-control attributes to the img element to prevent browser caching

requirements.summary: Add explicit cache-invalidation mechanism in the CoreTeam component by including a unique cache-busting key based on build timestamp or version number that forces React to treat the image as a completely new element
acceptanceCriteria: Image element includes a unique key prop based on version or timestamp
React treats the founder image as a new element requiring fresh render
Component forces re-mount of image element on version change
Developer tools show image request with updated cache-busting parameters

file_operations.description: Add a unique key prop to the founder image element based on a build timestamp or version number constant (e.g., key='barnali-v34-TIMESTAMP') to force React to treat the image as a completely new element requiring fresh render and re-mount
